metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5115 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Type confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 61.0.3163.79 for Windows allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5115` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.14.04.1202
chromium-browser-l10n - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.14.04.1202
chromium-chromedriver - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.14.04.1202
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.14.04.1202
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.14.04.1202
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.14.04.1202').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
